<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt;"> <!-- /TOC --> </DIV> <P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt;">1 <!-- PAGEBREAK --> <P><HR noshade><P> <H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table Contents</A></H5><P> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt;"> <A name='101'></A> </DIV> <!-- link1 "PART I" --> <DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"> <B>PART&nbsp;I</B> </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt;"> <A name='102'></A> </DIV> <!-- link1 "Items 1 2. Business Properties" --> <DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"></DIV> <TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt;"> <TR> <TD width="13%"></TD> <TD width="87%"></TD> </TR> <TR valign="top"> <TD><B>Items&nbsp;1 2.</B></TD> <TD> <B><I>Business Properties</I></B></TD> </TR> </TABLE> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Amerada Hess Corporation (the Registrant) Delaware corporation, incorporated 1920. The Registrant subsidiaries (collectively referred &#147;Corporation&#148;) explore for, produce, purchase, transport sell crude oil natural gas. These exploration production activities place United States, United Kingdom, Norway, Denmark, Equatorial Guinea, Algeria, Gabon, Indonesia, Thailand, Azerbaijan, countries. The Corporation manufactures, purchases, trades markets refined petroleum energy products. The Corporation owns 50% refinery joint venture United States Virgin Islands, refining facility, terminals retail gasoline stations located East Coast United States. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"> <B>Exploration Production</B> </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; At December&nbsp;31, 2004, Corporation 646&nbsp;million barrels proved crude oil natural gas liquids reserves, end 2003. Proved natural gas reserves 2,400&nbsp;million Mcf December&nbsp;31, 2004 compared 2,332&nbsp;million Mcf December&nbsp;31, 2003. Proved reserves December&nbsp;31, 2004 include 37% 52%, respectively, crude oil natural gas reserves held production sharing contracts. Of total proved reserves (on barrel oil equivalent basis), 17% located United States, 39% located United Kingdom, Norwegian Danish sectors North Sea, 17% located Africa remainder located Indonesia, Thailand, Azerbaijan. On barrel oil equivalent basis, 38% Corporation&#146;s December&nbsp;31, 2004 worldwide proved reserves undeveloped (32% 2003). Most proved undeveloped reserves relate properties developed Africa Asia. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Worldwide crude oil natural gas liquids production amounted 246,000&nbsp;barrels day 2004 compared 259,000&nbsp;barrels day 2003. Worldwide natural gas production 575,000&nbsp;Mcf day 2004 compared 683,000&nbsp;Mcf day 2003. On barrel oil equivalent basis, production continuing operations 342,000&nbsp;barrels day 2004 compared 360,000&nbsp;barrels day 2003. The Corporation presently estimates 2005&nbsp;barrel oil equivalent production approximately 350,000&nbsp;barrels day. name='309'></A> </DIV> <!-- link1 "NOTES CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS" --> <DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt;"> <B>NOTES CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</B> </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"></DIV> <TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt;"> <TR> <TD width="4%"></TD> <TD width="96%"></TD> </TR> <TR valign="top"> <TD><B>1.</B></TD> <TD> <B>Summary Significant Accounting Policies</B></TD> </TR> </TABLE> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <B><I>Nature Business:</I></B> Amerada Hess Corporation subsidiaries (the Corporation) engage exploration production, purchase, transportation sale crude oil natural gas. These activities conducted United States, United Kingdom, Norway, Denmark, Equatorial Guinea, Algeria, Azerbaijan, Gabon, Indonesia, Malaysia, countries. In addition, Corporation manufactures, purchases, transports, trades markets refined petroleum energy products. The Corporation owns 50% HOVENSA L.L.C., refinery joint venture United States Virgin Islands. An additional refining facility, terminals retail gasoline stations located East Coast United States. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; In preparing financial statements, management makes estimates assumptions affect reported amounts assets liabilities balance sheet revenues expenses income statement. Actual results differ estimates. Among estimates made management oil gas reserves, asset valuations, depreciable lives, pension liabilities, environmental obligations, dismantlement costs income taxes. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Certain information financial statements notes reclassified conform current period presentation. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <B><I>Principles Consolidation:</I></B> The consolidated financial statements include accounts Amerada Hess Corporation entities Corporation owns 50% voting interest entities Corporation controls. The Corporation&#146;s undivided interests unincorporated oil gas exploration production ventures proportionately consolidated. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Investments affiliated companies, 20% 50% owned, including HOVENSA excluding trading partnership, stated cost acquisition Corporation&#146;s equity undistributed net income acquisition. The change equity net income companies included non-operating income income statement. The Corporation consolidates trading partnership owns 50% voting interest exercises control. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Intercompany transactions accounts eliminated consolidation. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <B><I>Revenue Recognition:</I></B> The Corporation recognizes revenues sale crude oil, natural gas, petroleum products merchandise title passes customer. The Corporation recognizes revenues production natural gas properties based sales customers. Differences natural gas volumes sold Corporation&#146;s share natural gas production material. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; In exploration production activities, Corporation enters buy-sell arrangements crude oil involve linked sale purchase transactions primary purpose changing location quality. These arrangements reported net income statement. In refining marketing activities, Corporation exchanges refined products oil companies enters buy-sell arrangements involve linked sale purchase transactions counterparty purpose changing location quality. These arrangements reported net income statement. The amount netted buy-sell transactions 10% sales year year period ended December&nbsp;31, 2004. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Derivatives (futures, forwards, options swaps) energy trading activities marked market, net gains losses recorded operating revenue. Gains losses sale physical products recorded time sale. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <B><I>Cash Cash Equivalents:</I></B> Cash equivalents consist highly liquid investments, readily convertible cash maturities months acquired. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <B><I>Inventories:</I></B> Crude oil refined product inventories valued lower average cost market. For inventories valued cost, Corporation principally last-in, first-out (LIFO)&nbsp;inventory method. </DIV> <P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt;">47 <!-- PAGEBREAK --> <P><HR noshade><P> <H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table Contents</A></H5><P> <DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt;"> <B>AMERADA CORPORATION CONSOLIDATED SUBSIDIARIES</B> </DIV> <DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"> <B>NOTES CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;(Continued)</B> </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Inventories merchandise, materials supplies valued lower average cost market. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <B><I>Exploration Development Costs:</I></B> Oil gas exploration production activities accounted successful efforts method. Costs acquiring unproved proved oil gas leasehold acreage, including lease bonuses, brokers&#146; fees related costs, capitalized. Annual lease rentals, exploration expenses exploratory dry hole costs expensed incurred. Costs drilling equipping productive wells, including development dry holes, related production facilities capitalized. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The costs exploratory wells find oil gas reserves capitalized pending determination proved reserves found. In area requiring major capital expenditure production begin, exploration carried asset sufficient reserves discovered justify completion production well, additional exploration drilling underway firmly planned. The Corporation capitalize cost exploratory wells year proved reserves found. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <B><I>Depreciation, Depletion Amortization:</I></B> The Corporation calculates depletion expense acquisition costs proved properties units production method proved oil gas reserves. Depreciation depletion expense oil gas production equipment wells calculated units production method proved developed oil gas reserves. Depreciation plant equipment determined straight-line method based estimated lives. Provisions impairment undeveloped oil gas leases based periodic evaluations factors. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <B><I>Asset Retirement Obligations:</I></B> On January&nbsp;1, 2003, Corporation changed method accounting asset retirement obligations required FAS&nbsp;No.&nbsp;143, <I>Accounting Asset Retirement Obligations</I>. Previously, Corporation accrued estimated costs dismantlement, restoration abandonment, estimated salvage values, offshore oil gas production platforms pipelines units-of-production method. This cost reported component depreciation expense accumulated depreciation. Using accounting method required FAS&nbsp;No.&nbsp;143, Corporation recognizes liability fair legally required asset retirement obligations long-lived assets period retirement obligations incurred. The Corporation capitalizes asset retirement costs part carrying amount long-lived assets. The cumulative effect change prior years resulted credit income $7&nbsp;million $.07&nbsp;per share, basic diluted. The cumulative effect included income year ended December&nbsp;31, 2003. The effect change year 2003 increase income cumulative effect accounting change $3&nbsp;million, after-tax ($.03&nbsp;per share diluted). </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <B><I>Impairment Long-Lived Assets:</I></B> The Corporation reviews long-lived assets, including oil gas properties field level, impairment events circumstances carrying amounts recovered. If carrying amounts expected recovered undiscounted future cash flows, assets impaired impairment loss recorded. The amount impairment based estimated fair assets determined discounting anticipated future net cash flows. In case oil gas fields, net present future cash flows based management&#146;s estimate future prices, determined reference recent historical prices published forward prices, applied projected production volumes individual fields discounted rate commensurate risks involved. The projected production volumes represent reserves, including probable reserves, expected produced based stipulated amount capital expenditures. The production volumes, prices timing production consistent internal projections externally reported information. Oil gas prices determining asset impairments generally differ year-end prices standardized measure discounted future net cash flows. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <B><I>Impairment Equity Investees:</I></B> The Corporation reviews equity method investments impairment events circumstances temporary decline </DIV> <P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt;">48 <!-- PAGEBREAK --> <P><HR noshade><P> <H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table Contents</A></H5><P> <DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt;"> <B>AMERADA CORPORATION CONSOLIDATED SUBSIDIARIES</B> </DIV> <DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"> <B>NOTES CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;(Continued)</B> </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"> occurred. The amount impairment based quoted market prices, available, valuation techniques, including discounted cash flows. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <B><I>Impairment Goodwill:</I></B> In accordance FAS&nbsp;No.&nbsp;142, <I>Goodwill Other Intangible Assets</I>, goodwill amortized; however, tested annually impairment. This impairment test calculated reporting unit level, exploration production segment Corporation&#146;s goodwill. The Corporation identifies potential impairments comparing fair reporting unit book value, including goodwill. If fair reporting unit exceeds carrying amount, goodwill impaired. If carrying exceeds fair value, Corporation calculates impairment loss comparing implied fair goodwill carrying amount. If implied fair goodwill carrying amount, impairment recorded. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <B><I>Maintenance Repairs:</I></B> The estimated costs major maintenance, including turnarounds Port Reading refining facility, accrued. Other expenditures maintenance repairs expensed incurred. Capital improvements recorded additions property, plant equipment. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <B><I>Environmental Expenditures:</I></B> The Corporation capitalizes environmental expenditures increase life efficiency property reduce prevent environmental contamination. The Corporation accrues environmental expenses remediate existing conditions related past operations future costs probable estimable. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <B><I>Stock-Based Compensation:</I></B> The Corporation records compensation expense restricted common stock awards ratably vesting period. The Corporation intrinsic method account employee stock options. Because exercise prices employee stock options equal exceed market price stock date grant, Corporation recognize compensation expense (see Note&nbsp;9). The pro forma financial information presents effect net income earnings share Corporation fair method stock options. </DIV> <CENTER> <TABLE width="100%" align="center" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-size: 10pt; <B><I>Foreign Currency Translation:</I></B> The U.S.&nbsp;dollar functional currency (primary currency business conducted) foreign operations. For operations, adjustments resulting translating foreign currency assets liabilities U.S.&nbsp;dollars recorded income. For operations local currency functional currency, adjustments resulting translating foreign functional currency assets liabilities U.S.&nbsp;dollars recorded separate component stockholders&#146; equity </DIV> <P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt;">49 <!-- PAGEBREAK --> <P><HR noshade><P> <H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table Contents</A></H5><P> <DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt;"> <B>AMERADA CORPORATION CONSOLIDATED SUBSIDIARIES</B> </DIV> <DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"> <B>NOTES CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;(Continued)</B> </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"> entitled accumulated comprehensive income. Gains losses resulting transactions functional currency reflected net income. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <B><I>Hedging:</I></B> The Corporation futures, forwards, options swaps, individually combination, reduce effects fluctuations crude oil, natural gas refined product selling prices. Related hedge gains losses integral part selling purchase prices. Generally, derivatives designated hedges expected future cash flows forecasted transactions (cash flow hedges), fair recorded accumulated comprehensive income. These transactions meet requirements hedge accounting, including correlation. The Corporation reclassifies hedging gains losses included accumulated comprehensive income earnings time hedged transactions recognized. The ineffective portion hedges included current earnings. The Corporation&#146;s remaining derivatives, including foreign currency contracts, designated hedges change fair included income currently. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <B><I>Income Taxes:</I></B> Deferred income taxes determined liability method. The Corporation regularly assesses realizability deferred tax assets, based estimates future taxable income, availability tax planning strategies, existence appreciated assets, carryforward periods net operating losses factors. The Corporation provide deferred U.S.&nbsp;income taxes applicable undistributed earnings foreign subsidiaries indefinitely reinvested foreign operations. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <B><I>Accounting Change:</I></B> The Corporation adopted Emerging Issues Task Force abstract&nbsp;02-3, <I>Issues Involved Accounting Derivative Contracts Held Trading Purposes Contracts Involved Energy Trading Risk Management Activities</I>. In accordance EITF&nbsp;02-3, Corporation began accounting trading inventory purchased October&nbsp;25, 2002 lower cost market. Inventory purchased prior date marked-to-market reflected income currently. Beginning January&nbsp;1, 2003, Corporation accounted trading inventory lower cost market. This accounting change material effect Corporation&#146;s income financial position. </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"></DIV> <TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt;"> <TR> <TD width="4%"></TD> <TD width="96%"></TD> </TR> <TR valign="top"> <TD><B>2.</B></TD> <TD> <B>Items Affecting Income Continuing Operations</B></TD> </TR> </TABLE> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"> <B>AMERADA CORPORATION CONSOLIDATED SUBSIDIARIES</B> </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt;"> <A name='310'></A> </DIV> <!-- link1 "SUPPLEMENTARY OIL GAS DATA (Unaudited)" --> <DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"> <B>SUPPLEMENTARY OIL GAS DATA</B> </DIV> <DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt;"> <B>(Unaudited)</B> </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The supplementary oil gas data presented accordance Statement Financial Accounting Standards (FAS)&nbsp;No.&nbsp;69, <I>Disclosures Oil Gas Producing Activities</I>, includes (1)&nbsp;costs incurred, capitalized costs results operations relating oil gas producing activities, (2)&nbsp;net proved oil gas reserves, (3)&nbsp;a standardized measure discounted future net cash flows relating proved oil gas reserves, including reconciliation therein. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The Corporation produces crude oil and/or natural gas United States, Europe, Equatorial Guinea, Algeria, Gabon, Indonesia, Azerbaijan. Exploration activities conducted, planned, additional countries. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; During 2004, development plan Okume Complex approved government Equatorial Guinea major contracts construction authorized. Production expected commence 2007. Additional gas sales negotiated covering Block A-18 joint development area (JDA). First production JDA commenced 2005 original gas sales contract. During 2004, Ujung Pangkah gas sales agreement approved. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; During 2003, Corporation exchanged interests producing oil gas fields United Kingdom increased interest Gulf field. The Corporation sold producing properties Gulf Shelf, Jabung Field small United Kingdom fields. The Corporation exchanged producing properties Colombia additional 25% interest JDA. Because exchange, Corporation consolidated oil gas interests JDA. In 2003, Corporation exchanged 25% equity investment Premier Oil plc interest producing field Indonesia. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt; margin-left: 0; #000000; background: #ffffff;"> <B>Oil Gas Reserves</B> </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The Corporation&#146;s oil gas reserves calculated accordance SEC regulations interpretations requirements Financial Accounting Standards Board. For reserves booked proved commercially producible; government approvals obtained depending amount project cost, senior management board directors commit fund project. The Corporation&#146;s oil gas reserve estimation reporting process involves annual independent party reserve determination internal technical appraisals reserves. The Corporation maintains internal reserve estimates calculated technical staff work directly oil gas properties. The Corporation&#146;s technical staff updates reserve estimates year based evaluations wells, performance reviews, technical data studies. To provide consistency Corporation, standard reserve estimation guidelines, definitions, reporting reviews approval practices used. The internal reserve estimates subject internal technical audits senior management reviews estimates. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The oil gas reserve estimates reported determined independently consulting firm DeGolyer MacNaughton (D&#38;M) consistent internal estimates. Annually, Corporation D&#38;M engineering, geological geophysical data, actual production histories information reserve determination. The Corporation&#146;s D&#38;M&#146;s technical staffs meet review discuss information provided. margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <I>Nature Business:</I> HOVENSA&nbsp;L.L.C. (Company) formed joint venture Petroleos de Venezuela,&nbsp;SA. (PDVSA)&nbsp;and Amerada Hess Corporation (AHC)&nbsp;to operate Company&#146;s refinery. The Company purchases crude oil PDVSA, AHC parties. It manufactures sells petroleum products primarily PDVSA AHC. In preparing financial statements, management makes estimates assumptions affect reported amounts assets liabilities balance sheet revenues expenses statement income. Actual results differ estimates. Estimates made management include: inventory asset valuations, environmental obligations, depreciable lives turnaround accruals. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The Company jointly owned PDVSA&nbsp;V.I., Inc. ("JPMCB"), Administrative Agent (in capacity "Administrative Agent"), Bank America, N.A., Barclays Bank, Citibank, N.A. The Royal Bank Scotland plc, Co-Syndication Agents Bank Tokyo-Mitsubishi, Ltd., Bayerische Landesbank, BNP Paribas The Bank Nova Scotia, Co-Documentation Agents. The Company requested Lenders extend credit enable borrow revolving credit basis date hereof time time time prior Maturity Date (such term capitalized term defined meaning assigned Article I) principal amount excess $2,500,000,000 time outstanding. The Company requested Lenders establish procedures pursuant Company invite Lenders bid uncommitted basis borrowings Company maturing prior Maturity Date. The Company requested Issuing Banks issue Letters Credit support payment obligations Company Subsidiaries. The proceeds borrowings hereunder general corporate purposes Company Subsidiaries, including financing working capital requirements payment maturing commercial paper, Letters Credit general corporate purposes Company Subsidiaries. The Lenders extend credit Company terms subject conditions set forth. Accordingly, parties hereto agree follows: ARTICLE Definitions SECTION 1.01.Defined Terms. As Agreement, terms meanings below: "ABR", reference Loan Borrowing, means Loan, Loans comprising Borrowing, bearing interest rate determined reference Alternate Base Rate. <PAGE> 2 "Accommodation Guaranty Indebtedness" meaning ascribed Article VII(e). "Adjusted LIBO Rate" means, respect Eurodollar Borrowing Interest Period, interest rate annum (rounded upwards, necessary, 1/100 1%) equal (a) LIBO Rate Interest Period multiplied (b) Statutory Reserve Rate. "Administrative Agent" meaning ascribed preamble Agreement. "Administrative Questionnaire" means Administrative Questionnaire form supplied Administrative Agent. "Affiliate" means, respect Person, Person directly, indirectly intermediaries, Controls Controlled common Control Person specified. "Agents" means Administrative Agent, Co-Syndication Agents Co-Documentation Agents. "Alternate Base Rate" means, day, rate annum equal higher (a) Prime Rate effect day (b) Federal Funds Effective Rate effect day 1/2 1%. Any change Alternate Base Rate due change Prime Rate Federal Funds Effective Rate effective including effective date change Prime Rate Federal Funds Effective Rate, respectively. "Applicable Facility Fee Rate" means, day, respect Facility Fees payable hereunder, applicable rate annum set based Public Debt Ratings set below: <TABLE> <CAPTION> Public Debt Applicable Rating S&P/Moody's Facility Fee Rate - ------------------ ----------------- <S> <C> Level 0.100% > = BBB+ / Baa1 Level 0.150% BBB / Baa2 Level 0.200% BBB- / Baa3 Level 0.250% BB+ / Ba1 </TABLE> <PAGE> 3 <TABLE> <S> <C> Level 0.500% Below < BB+ / Ba1 </TABLE> "Applicable Margin" means, day, (a) respect Eurodollar Revolving Loan, applicable rate annum set caption "Eurodollar Spread" based Public Debt Ratings set (b) respect ABR Revolving Loan, Applicable Margin effect day Eurodollar Revolving Loans minus 1.00% (but 0%): <TABLE> <CAPTION> Public Debt Rating S&P/Moody's Eurodollar Spread ----------- ----------------- <S> <C> Level 0.525% > = BBB+ / Baa1 Level 0.600% BBB / Baa2 Level 0.800% BBB- / Baa3 Level 1.000% BB+ / Ba1 Level 1.250% Below < BB+ / Ba1 </TABLE> "Applicable Percentage" means, respect Lender, percentage total Commitments represented Lender's Commitment. If Commitments terminated expired, Applicable Percentages determined based Commitments recently effect, giving effect assignments. "Assignment Acceptance" means assignment acceptance entered Lender assignee (with consent party consent required Section 9.04), accepted Administrative Agent, form Exhibit A form approved Administrative Agent. "Availability Period" means period including Effective Date excluding earlier Maturity Date date termination Commitments. "Board" means Board Governors Federal Reserve System United States America. <PAGE> 4 "Borrowing" means (a) Revolving Loans Type, made, converted continued date and, case Eurodollar Loans, single Interest Period effect (b) Competitive Loan group Competitive Loans Type made date single Interest Period effect. "Borrowing Request" means request Company Revolving Loans accordance Section 2.03. "Business Day" means day Saturday, Sunday day commercial banks New York City authorized required law remain closed; provided term "Business Day" exclude, connection Eurodollar Loan, day banks open dealings dollar deposits London interbank market. "Capital Lease" means, respect Person lessee thereunder, lease charter property, real personal, would, accordance GAAP, recorded asset capital lease balance sheet Person. "Capitalized Lease Obligation" means, respect Person date, amount would, accordance GAAP, recorded obligation Capital Lease balance sheet Person lessee Capital Lease date. For purposes Agreement, Capitalized Lease Obligations deemed Debt secured Lien. "Change Law" means (a) adoption law, rule regulation date Agreement, (b) change law, rule regulation interpretation application thereof Governmental Authority date Agreement (c) compliance Lender (or, purposes Section 2.14(b), lending office Lender Lender's holding company, any) request, guideline directive (whether force law) Governmental Authority made issued date Agreement. "Class", reference Loan Borrowing, refers Loan, Loans comprising Borrowing, Revolving Loans Competitive Loans. "Code" means Internal Revenue Code 1986, amended time time. "Co-Documentation Agents" meaning ascribed preamble Agreement. "Commitment" means, respect Lender, commitment Lender make Revolving Loans acquire participations Letters Credit, commitment (a) reduced time time pursuant Section 2.08 (b) reduced increased time time pursuant assignments Lender <PAGE> 5 pursuant Section 9.04. The initial amount Lender's Commitment set Schedule 2.01, Assignment Acceptance pursuant Lender assumed Commitment, applicable. "Company" means Amerada Hess Corporation, Delaware corporation. "Company Capitalization Ratio" means, date, ratio, expressed percentage, (i) Total Consolidated Debt Company Consolidated Subsidiaries date (ii) Total Capitalization Company Consolidated Subsidiaries date. "Competitive", reference Loan Borrowing, means Loan, Loans comprising Borrowing, made accordance Section 2.04. "Competitive Bid" means offer Lender make Competitive Loan accordance Section 2.04. "Competitive Bid Rate" means, respect Competitive Bid, Margin Fixed Rate, applicable, offered Lender making Competitive Bid. "Competitive Bid Request" means request Company Competitive Bids accordance Section 2.04. "Consolidated Current Liabilities" means, respect Person date, amounts which, conformity GAAP, classified current liabilities consolidated balance sheet Person Consolidated Subsidiaries date. "Consolidated EBITDA" means, Person period, Consolidated Net Income person period, (a) duplication extent deducted determining Consolidated Net Income, sum (i) consolidated interest expense period, (ii) consolidated income tax expense period, (iii) amounts attributable depreciation amortization (including limitation impairment oil gas reserves, properties leases) period (iv) extraordinary non-cash charges period, minus (b) duplication extent included determining Consolidated Net Income, extraordinary gains period, determined consolidated basis accordance GAAP. "Consolidated Intangibles" means, respect Person date, assets Person Consolidated Subsidiaries, determined consolidated basis, would, conformity GAAP, classified intangible assets consolidated balance sheet Person Consolidated Subsidiaries date, including, limitation, unamortized debt discount expense, unamortized organization reorganization expense, costs excess fair market acquired companies, patents, trade service marks, franchises, trade names, goodwill <PAGE> 6 amount write-ups book assets resulting revaluation thereof (other revaluations arising foreign currency valuations conformity GAAP). "Consolidated Net Income" means, period, net income (or net deficit) Company Consolidated Subsidiaries period, determined consolidated basis accordance GAAP. "Consolidated Net Tangible Assets" means, respect Person date, amount equal (a) amount would, conformity GAAP, included assets consolidated balance sheet Person Consolidated Subsidiaries date minus (b) sum (i) Consolidated Intangibles Person date (ii) Consolidated Current Liabilities Person date. "Consolidated Subsidiaries" means, respect Person date, Subsidiaries entities accounts consolidated accounts Person date accordance principles consolidation reflected audited financial statements Person date delivered accordance Section 5.01. "Continuing Directors" meaning ascribed Article VII. "Contractual Obligation" means, Person, provision security issued Person agreement, instrument undertaking Person party property bound. "Control" means possession, directly indirectly, power direct direction management policies Person, ability exercise voting power, contract otherwise. "Controlling" "Controlled" meanings correlative thereto. "Co-Syndication Agents" meaning ascribed preamble Agreement. Any capitalized term defined Agreement meaning ascribed thereto Plan. The Optionee acknowledges receipt disclosure document relating describing Plan Awards thereunder Optionee read carefully fully understands content. In event conflict terms Agreement terms Plan, terms Plan control. 2. OPTIONS. As Grant Date above, Corporation grants Optionee, non-qualified stock options (each, "Option" collectively, "Options") acquire Corporation Per Share Exercise Price Option aggregate number shares Common Stock Option (the "Option Shares"). The Option(s) treated (and intended qualify as) incentive stock options meaning Section 422 Code. 3. PAYMENTS EQUIVALENT DIVIDENDS. Prior acquisition Option Shares exercise Option, Optionee entitled receive cash payment distribution respect Option Shares underlying Option. 4. EXERCISE OPTION. 4.1 Unless exercisability Option accelerated terms Plan Agreement, Options theretofore terminated exercisable follows: (i) one-third Option Shares (rounded nearest number shares) exercisable anniversary Grant Date (ii) one-third Option Shares (rounded nearest number shares) exercisable anniversary Grant Date (iii) remainder Option Shares exercisable anniversary Grant Date. 4.2 Unless earlier terminated accordance terms Plan Agreement, Options expire longer exercisable {EXPIRATION DATE}. 4.3 In event Option exercisable fractional share Common Stock. 5. METHOD EXERCISE PAYMENT. Once exercisable, Option exercised part Optionee delivering Secretary Corporation designated agent (who, long Corporation maintains "cashless exercise" program Optionee exercises sells Option Shares program, administrator program) business day (the "Exercise Date") notice, manner form required Corporation, number Option Shares Optionee desires acquire (the "Exercise Notice"). The Exercise Notice accompanied payment aggregate Per Share Exercise Price applicable Option number Option Shares acquired exercise. Such payment made cash, personal certified check, bank draft money order payable order Corporation or, permitted Committee (in sole discretion) applicable law, rule regulation, delivery of, conjunction partial cash instrument payment, <PAGE> -3- (a) shares Common Stock owned Participant months, (b) form payment acceptable Committee. To extend permitted law, Committee Optionee simultaneously exercise Option sell shares Common Stock acquired pursuant "cashless exercise" arrangement program, selected approved respects advance Committee. Payment instruments received Corporation subject collection. The proceeds received Corporation exercise Option Corporation general corporate purposes. Any portion Option exercised exercised again. Upon exercise accordance terms Plan Agreement, Option Shares underlying exercised portion Option promptly delivered Optionee, long Corporation maintains "cashless exercise" program Optionee exercises sells Option Shares program, delivery proceeds sale made brokerage account maintained Optionee administrator program. 6. TERMINATION FORFEITURE. 6.1 Unless determined Committee, Options terminate accordance Sections 6.2, 6.3 6.4 below, case be. In event, Options terminate [EXPIRATION DATE]. 6.2 Subject determination Committee pursuant Section 6.01 Plan, Optionee's employment Corporation Subsidiary terminates reason (other reason Optionee's death, disability normal retirement Corporation's Employees' Pension Plan successor plan thereto) Options, extent exercisable date termination employment, forfeited cancelled Corporation. The Optionee's rights, any, exercise exercisable portion Option terminate sixty days date termination employment (other reason Optionee's death, disability, normal early retirement Corporation's Employees' Pension Plan successor plan thereto), [EXPIRATION DATE], Options forfeited cancelled Corporation. 6.3 If Optionee's employment Corporation Subsidiary terminates reason Optionee's death, disability, normal retirement Corporation's Employees' Pension Plan successor plan thereto, Optionee (or Optionee's estate, designated beneficiary legal representative, case determined Committee) exercise Options time [EXPIRATION DATE]. The existence date Optionee's disability determined Committee determination conclusive. <PAGE> -4- 6.4 (a) Notwithstanding contrary Section 6.2 above, Optionee's employment Corporation Subsidiary terminates reason Optionee's early retirement Corporation's Employees' Pension Plan successor plan thereto, Options extent exercisable date early retirement remain exercisable [EXPIRATION DATE]. (b) Notwithstanding contrary Section 6.2 above, Optionee's employment Corporation Subsidiary terminates reason Optionee's early retirement Corporation's Employees' Pension Plan successor plan thereto, Committee, sole discretion, (but obligated to) determine (i) Option extent exercisable time early retirement exercisable proportionate number underlying Option Shares based number calendar days elapsed (as date early retirement) vesting period Option (or portion thereof), (ii) Option remain exercisable [EXPIRATION DATE]. Except Options exercisable prior sentence, Option extent exercisable time Optionee's termination employment reason early retirement forfeited cancelled Corporation. 7. CHANGE CONTROL. The Options subject acceleration exercisability "cash-out" discretion Committee occurrence Change Control, provided subject Plan. 8. NON-TRANSFERABILITY.
